description: From Middle English thankful, from Old English þancful, þancfull (“thoughtful, pleasing, agreeable, pleasant, thankful, grateful”), equivalent to thank +‎ -ful. Compare Old High German undankfol (“unthankful, ungrateful”).

adjectives.description: thankful (comparative more thankful, superlative most thankful)

examples: I'm thankful that you helped me out today. How can I ever repay you?
